_exec_summary.SummaryText:
It is the policy of the Farmers Union Oil Co. & Agronomy Center of Stanley and Tioga, ND to comply with all requirements on the Federal, State, and Local Levels, to constantly improve our facilities and educate current staff to meet these guidelines and recommendations.  In regard to the EPA requirements an the RMP (Risk Management Program) the Farmers Union Oil Agronomy Center in Tioga takes measure on this issue as to provide and install a program that will develop a safety agenda to the staff members of our facility and the surrounding community populace of our establishment.

The company policy is also to provide current up to date safety information to operating and other personnel involved with the facility and provide correct technical information to operate the facility in a safe and efficient manner and that adequate management systems are in place to insure implementation and accuaracy.

Our Local RMP Cordinator - Craig Postovit is knowledgable on the facility operations and procedures, being a staff member for the past 16 years in this department, his experience and past accreditations in various technical and safety seminars have assisted the facilities operations of issues regarding, but not limited to, the hazards associated with regulated substances, full facility equipment operations, and safeguards used and needed to control hazards or prevent equipment malfunctions, and to meet all industry standards, federal, state, or local design rules, and to operate the facilities in accordance with applicable standards and regulations.

This original Tioga facility, operated by the Farmers Union Oil and Agronomy Center of Stanley and Tioga, has maintained its present location, has provided agronomy services to the local area for over 20 years, with no incidence of previous reportable spills or releases, no prior accidents regarding death, significant bodily injury or property damage.  This safety record should assure the community of the company's and staff m

ember's commitment to safety operations and quality practices.  Although all safety issues are respected, in the event of an accidental spill or release of anhydrous ammonia into the atmosphere, the Farmers Union Agronomy Center of Tioga and the RMP Cordinator an staff shall take all necessary and proper actions in response to such an incident, and support the local authorities, all Emergency Responders and to provide information and assistance that may be beneficial or diminish any enviormental or property damage and to promote the safety of all community citizens.
